text: Marcel Martel (February 1, 1925 – April 13, 1999) was a French Canadian singer-songwriter and composer. Born in Drummondville, Quebec, and playing country music since childhood, Martel first found success in 1947 with his songs La Chaine de nos coeurs and Souvenir de mon enfance. Over the course of a thirty five-year career he released nearly two hundred records, frequently collaborating with his wife Noëlla Therrien, his daughter Renée Martel, and fellow Québécois country singer Paul Brunelle. == Further reading == * Boulanger, André (1983). Marcel Martel: au jardin de mes souveinrs. title: Marcel Martel (musician)
